summary: This is a memo summarizing a deposition taken on December 4, 2009, of a female witness/victim in the Epstein case. The witness describes her interactions with Jeffrey Epstein, including details of sexualized massages, payments, photography, and her recruitment of other girls. She also discusses her personal life, drug use, and relationships with other individuals.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure the deposition is about. The witness describes visiting him for massages, receiving payments, being photographed nude, and being asked to bring other young girls.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the witness talked to, likely in the context of setting up appointments with Epstein.

persons.name: Dr.
persons.context: A doctor who prescribed oxycodone to the witness. The witness also states she felt 'Dr. was an idiot' and that Dr. saw her since she was 13.

connections.description: Maxwell is mentioned alongside other employees who would call the witness to set up appointments with Epstein.
The witness states she met Dr. through her attorneys, and Dr. had seen her since she was 13, suggesting a connection through the legal/medical aspects of the case.

events.title: Deposition of Witness
events.description: A deposition was taken of a witness/victim in the Epstein case, summarized in this memo.

events.title: First Visit to Epstein
events.description: The witness first saw Jeffrey Epstein in May 2002. She states she told him she was going to be 14.

events.title: Last Visit to Epstein
events.description: The witness last saw Jeffrey Epstein sometime in August 2003.

events.title: Resumed Drug Use
events.description: The witness started using drugs again in January 2005.

events.title: Detox Treatments
events.description: The witness was detoxed from drugs at least twice in 2009, once in her living room and once at CARP.

keyFacts: The witness/victim first visited Jeffrey Epstein in May 2002 when she was about to turn 14, and her last visit was in August 2003.
Epstein paid her $200-$300 per visit, asked her to undress during massages, took nude photographs of her with a digital camera throughout his house, and asked her to bring other young girls.
The witness states she never had intercourse with Epstein but did have another girl perform a sexual act on her at his residence.
The witness used money given to her by Epstein to buy drugs, including cocaine, and Epstein was aware of her drug use.

The deposition reveals the witness's extensive personal struggles, including drug addiction (oxycodone, heroin, cocaine, ecstasy, crystal meth), an escort service history, and alleged abuse by a boyfriend.
